message: Here a frontend little little bug http://ge.tt/4yhmv6V The X to close the window is a bit hidden. Obviously not important...
just saying that "real-time" (incl. streaming effects) is evoked as a major difference of Convore vs plainold forums, and I'm wondering if the public will validate this.

@ccarnino yeah, bummer about no line breaks in a message, but I guess this is to encourage short messages and rapid exchanges, esp. since IRC is mentioned as an inspiration by @leah. I'd actually love to see a Convore group with IRC-style rapid-exchange going on.
my message input looks like a one-liner initially and since entering a sentence or two is what you usually want to do, enter seems like a fine shortcut for sending a message

@zenbat If you press shift-enter in the input area you get what I would call a line break.

Is this not what you mean?

@jonathanj thanks, actually I realised I'd missed something looking at @ccarnino's post. But if line-breaks are legal, then <ENTER> should be have the expected behaviour, given that the message input looks like a textarea.
sure - what's the worst that can happen: make the mistake once, delete, re-send...

Hi @convore team!
Here is some feedback that I've collected and I want to share with you. 
-Hour 2am San Francisco, the server takes about 5-10 to serve the pages.
-Lot of groups but very few discussions
-Edit the message I've sent. With enter occurs to send a message not finished. I can't edit. I can delete and resend.
-I would love to have the notifications just about the conversation where I've participated or followed, not the entire group. This because there is a lot of conversation and I'm not intereste to all the conversation about HN... This is personal.

-Great design and frontend interaction!
-Great minimal design!
-Great there's a mobile app. Also if minimal.
I know about shift enter, was just feedback for a user who for the first time approach to this service
It's true that if that "limitation" is a will fo the creators means that want  create a certain behavior in the usage of the service
